transportAdvice: Chefchaouen's compact medina is best explored entirely on foot, as the narrow blue-painted streets are not accessible by vehicles; grand taxis are available for intercity travel to nearby towns like Tetouan or Fes, and local petit taxis serve the broader town area.

weather.description: Cool and often rainy winter month with occasional mountain mist; pack warm layers and a waterproof jacket.
Still cool and wet with frequent showers; the mountains can see cold snaps and the medina feels quiet and atmospheric.
Temperatures begin to rise and spring hints emerge; rain is still possible but days are increasingly pleasant.
A lovely spring month with mild temperatures and blooming hillsides; one of the better times to visit.
Warm and mostly dry with comfortable conditions; ideal for hiking the surrounding Rif Mountains.
Hot and dry with long sunny days; early mornings and evenings are the most comfortable times to explore.
Peak summer heat with very little rain; the blue medina is busy with tourists and afternoons can be intense.
Equally hot as July with dry conditions; seek shade during midday and stay hydrated while exploring.
Heat begins to ease and crowds thin slightly; a pleasant month with warm days and cooler evenings.
Autumn brings comfortable temperatures and occasional rain; the light is beautiful and the town is less crowded.
Noticeably cooler with increasing rainfall; a quieter period that suits travelers who prefer a more local atmosphere.
Cold and wet with short days; the medina takes on a moody, peaceful character with far fewer visitors.
